nodes.label: Graphs Overview
nodes.title: Graphs Overview
nodes.content: This note gives an overview of graphs and links to [[DFS]], [[BFS]], and [[Graph Traversal]].

nodes.label: DFS
nodes.title: DFS
nodes.content: Depth-first search is a traversal algorithm that explores as far as possible before backtracking.

nodes.label: BFS
nodes.title: BFS
nodes.content: Breadth-first search explores all neighbors before going deeper.

nodes.label: Graph Representation
nodes.title: Graph Representation
nodes.content: Graphs can be represented using adjacency lists, matrices, or edge lists.

nodes.label: Use Cases
nodes.title: Use Cases
nodes.content: Graphs are used in social networks, routing, recommendation systems, etc.

nodes.label: Graph Traversal
nodes.title: Graph Traversal
nodes.content: Overview of different graph traversal techniques like [[DFS]] and [[BFS]].

nodes.label: Adjacency Matrix
nodes.title: Adjacency Matrix
nodes.content: One way to represent a graph, especially useful for dense graphs.

nodes.label: Real-world Graphs
nodes.title: Real-world Graphs
nodes.content: Discussion of how graphs are used in real-world apps.
